alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Canyon Ferry Area; Cascade County below 5000ft; East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Fergus County below 4500ft; Gates of the Mountains; Helena Valley; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Meagher County Valleys; Northern Blaine County; Northern High Plains; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 3:17PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Accumulating Small Hail Possible... Showers and thunderstorms continue to develop and lift north and northeastward across Central and North Central Montana through the afternoon and early evening hours. Some thunderstorms could produce accumulating small hail to a few inches deep, which would then lead to covered roadways and slippery conditions. Motorist should be prepared for rapidly changing conditions over short distance and adjust speeds to match road conditions.
